translated: I brought it as an offering.ğŸ”½At that time,ğŸ”½the Buddha, the chief of the world, the best of men,
was standing on the path,
in the sky, in the windless atmosphere.
Seeing that wonder,
that marvel that made the hairs stand up,
I put down the bronze bowl
and looked on, paying homage.
You are the god who knows all,
together with the gods and humans.
Out of compassion,
accept it, Great Sage.
The Buddha, the one who knows all, the leader of the world,ğŸ”½accepted it,
knowing my intention,
the Teacher, the Great Sage in the world.
For ninety-one eons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not remember any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the rice porridge.
For twenty-one eons,
was a Buddha named Khattiya;
He was endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
